meanings.definition: To write or compose an elegy.
meanings.sent1: She elegized the passing of her beloved pet in a heartfelt poem.
meanings.sent2: The poet elegized the fallen soldiers in his latest work.
meanings.sent3: The students elegized their failed experiment in a creative song.
meanings.sent4: The artist elegized the fading beauty of the old city in his painting.
meanings.sent5: The author elegized the end of an era with poignant words.

meanings.definition: To mourn or lament in an elegy.
meanings.sent1: The community elegized the loss of a respected leader during the memorial service.
meanings.sent2: She elegized the tragic event in a moving tribute.
meanings.sent3: The family elegized their burnt dinner in a humorous skit.
meanings.sent4: The singer elegized lost love in a soulful ballad.
meanings.sent5: The town elegized the closing of the historic theater with a candlelight vigil.
